alert.note: Alert for Colquitt; Decatur; Grady; Mitchell; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:39AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Decatur, Grady, southeastern Mitchell, northwestern Thomas and southwestern Colquitt Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1139 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Whigham to 10 miles south of Cairo. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cairo, Pelham, Camilla, Thomasville, Ochlocknee, Whigham, Capel, Cotton, Rocky Hill, Harrells Still, Princes Still, Peoples Still, Quality, Branchville, Vada, Akridge, Grady Co A/p, Moncrief, Elpino and Reno. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for Big Bend of Florida...and south central and southwestern Georgia.
